Interface JCGLStencilBuffersType

    OpenGL interface to stencil buffers.

    • Method Detail

      • stencilBufferClear

        void stencilBufferClear(int stencil)
                 throws JCGLException,
                        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Clear the stencil buffer with the specified value stencil.
        Parameters:
        stencil - The stencil value.
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferDisable

        void stencilBufferDisable()
                   throws JCGLException,
                          JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Disable the stencil test.
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an internal OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferEnable

        void stencilBufferEnable()
                  throws JCGLException,
                         JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Enable the stencil test.
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an internal OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferFunction

        void stencilBufferFunction(JCGLFaceSelection faces,
                           JCGLStencilFunction function,
                           int reference,
                           int mask)
                    throws JCGLException,
                           JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Set the stencil function and reference value for the faces given by faces. The value mask is ANDed with the reference value and the stored stencil buffer value when function is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        faces - The face selection
        function - The stencil function
        reference - The reference value
        mask - The value to AND with the reference and stored stencil values
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an internal OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferGetBits

        int stencilBufferGetBits()
                  throws JCGLException
        Returns:
        The number of bits available in the stencil buffer for the current framebuffer configuration
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an OpenGL error occurs

      • stencilBufferIsEnabled

        boolean stencilBufferIsEnabled()
                        throws JCGLException,
                               JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Returns:
        true iff stencil testing is enabled
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferMask

        void stencilBufferMask(JCGLFaceSelection faces,
                       int mask)
                throws JCGLException,
                       JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer
        Control the writing of bits in the stencil buffer for the faces given by faces. The least significant bits in the value mask are used to control writing of bits; Where a 1 appears in the mask, it's possible to write to the corresponding bit in the stencil buffer. Where a 0 appears, the corresponding bit is write-protected. Initially, all bits are enabled for writing.
        Parameters:
        mask - The stencil mask
        faces - The face selection
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an internal OpenGL error occurs
        JCGLExceptionNoStencilBuffer - If no stencil buffer is available

      • stencilBufferOperation

        void stencilBufferOperation(JCGLFaceSelection faces,
                            JCGLStencilOperation stencil_fail,
                            JCGLStencilOperation depth_fail,
                            JCGLStencilOperation pass)
                     throws JCGLException
        Configure the operations to be performed on the stencil buffer for the faces given by faces.
        Parameters:
        faces - The face selection
        stencil_fail - The operation to perform when the stencil test fails
        depth_fail - The operation to perform when the stencil test passes but the depth test fails
        pass - The operation to perform when the stencil and depth test (if any) passes
        Throws:
        JCGLException - Iff an internal OpenGL error occurs

      • stencilBufferGetMaskFrontFaces

        int stencilBufferGetMaskFrontFaces()
        Returns:
        The mask value specified for front faces

      • stencilBufferGetMaskBackFaces

        int stencilBufferGetMaskBackFaces()
        Returns:
        The mask value specified for back faces

        Returns:
        The operation specified for back faces that fail the depth test

      • stencilBufferGetOperationPassBack

        JCGLStencilOperation stencilBufferGetOperationPassBack()
        Returns:
        The operation specified for back faces that pass all tests
